improvement_list.improvement_desc: Division by zero error in line 4. Add a check to ensure the denominator is not zero before performing the division.
The conditional statement in line 4 will always evaluate to false because division by zero results in an error; therefore, the code within the if block is unreachable.
The basic blocks corresponding to lines 5 and 6 have no executions. It implies the else block is never reached. This highlights a potential logic error and an unreachable code path.
Add input validation to prevent division by zero. For example, you could check if the denominator is zero before the division operation.
Since the conditional statement always results in an error, the entire conditional statement can be removed. The program can directly print "False".
